intro: Minuria candollei var. denticulata, commonly known as the denticulate minuria, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbellate inflorescences. The plant features slender, hairy stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are narrow, serrated, and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Due to its limited habitat and specific environmental requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
